FFT_CTRL

Absolute Address:
Base Offset:
0x6
Size:
0x2
Source:
registers.rdl

Contents

Bits Identifier Access Reset Decoded Name
[15:12] DELAY_LINE_CTRL rw 0x0 -
[11] DWA_EN rw 0x0 -
[10:9] N_QUANTIZER_BITS rw 0x0 -
[8] NOISE_SHAPING_EN rw 0x0 -
[7] INCREMENTAL_MODE_EN rw 0x0 -
[6:3] NFFT_POWER rw 0x0 -
[2:0] OSR_POWER rw 0x0 -

Field Descriptions

DELAY_LINE_CTRL

SAR asynchronous delay control. Higher values will lead to longer SAR clock periods.

DWA_EN

If 1, enables DWA during FFT conversion. Else, there will be no DEM whatsoever.

N_QUANTIZER_BITS

Number of bits to quantize, minus one. That is, the SAR will quantize N_QUANTIZER_BITS + 1.

NOISE_SHAPING_EN

If 0, run an NFFT conversion with SAR quantizer only. If 1, run with noise-shaping.

INCREMENTAL_MODE_EN

If 1, runs the ADC in incremental mode, meaning that the reset will be applied and the output will be filtered (up-counted). Else, runs in delta-sigma mode, and there will be no filtering at the output.

NFFT_POWER

FFT power. When taking FFT samples, the ADC will take 2^NFFT_POWER samples. There are only 2^14 samples available in memory, so if in continuous mode, then OSR*NFFT <= 2^14. If in incremental mode, then up-counters will deal with OSR, so NFFT_POWER<=14.

OSR_POWER

OSR power - configures ADC to have an oversampling ratio of 2^OSR_POWER. This allows an OSR of up to 128.
